line.token: * This file is part of the Symfony package.

* file that was distributed with this source code.
'\LegacyPdoSessionHandler class is deprecated since version 2.6 and will be removed in 3.0. Use the Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Session\Storage\Handler\PdoSessionHandler class instead.'
* Session handler using a PDO connection to read and write data.
* Session data is a binary string that can contain non-printable characters like the null byte.
* For this reason this handler base64 encodes the data to be able to save it in a character column.
* This version of the PdoSessionHandler does NOT implement locking. So concurrent requests to the
* same session can result in data loss due to race conditions.
* @deprecated since version 2.6, to be removed in 3.0. Use
* * db_table: The name of the table [required]
* * db_id_col: The column where to store the session id [default: sess_id]
* * db_data_col: The column where to store the session data [default: sess_data]
* * db_time_col: The column where to store the timestamp [default: sess_time]
* @param array $dbOptions An associative array of DB options
'You must provide the "db_table" option for a PdoSessionStorage.'
'"%s" requires PDO error mode attribute be set to throw Exceptions (i.e. $pdo->setAttribute(PDO::ATTR_ERRMODE, PDO::ERRMODE_EXCEPTION))'
// delete the record associated with this id
'PDOException was thrown when trying to delete a session: %s'
// delete the session records that have expired
'PDOException was thrown when trying to delete expired sessions: %s'
// We use fetchAll instead of fetchColumn to make sure the DB cursor gets closed
'PDOException was thrown when trying to read the session data: %s'
// We use a single MERGE SQL query when supported by the database.
// When MERGE is not supported, like in Postgres, we have to use this approach that can result in
// duplicate key errors when the same session is written simultaneously. We can just catch such an
// error and re-execute the update. This is similar to a serializable transaction with retry logic
// on serialization failures but without the overhead and without possible false positives due to
// Handle integrity violation SQLSTATE 23000 (or a subclass like 23505 in Postgres) for duplicate keys
'PDOException was thrown when trying to write the session data: %s'
* Returns a merge/upsert (i.e. insert or update) SQL query when supported by the database.
* @return string|null The SQL string or null when not supported
// DUAL is Oracle specific dummy table
// MERGE is only available since SQL Server 2008 and must be terminated by semicolon
// It also requires HOLDLOCK according to http://weblogs.sqlteam.com/dang/archive/2009/01/31/UPSERT-Race-Condition-With-MERGE.aspx
WITH (HOLDLOCK) USING (SELECT 1 AS dummy) AS src ON (
